level.text: Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 1 infraction:
20 DCMR § 107.1 (failure to have operative or effective air pollution control device);
20 DCMR § 200.1 (failure to obtain air pollution construction or modification permit);
20 DCMR § 200.2 (failure to obtain air pollution operation permit);
20 DCMR § 205.1 (failure to comply with New Source Performance Standards);
20 DCMR § 401.7 (failure to timely submit an emergency episode abatement plan);
20 DCMR § 401.10 (failure to comply with emergency abatement plan);
20 DCMR § 501.1 (failure to install/maintain/operate monitor or provide monitoring information);
20 DCMR § 501.2 (failure to conduct ambient monitoring);
20 DCMR § 501.3 (failure to comply with ambient monitoring requirements);
20 DCMR § 502.10 (failure to comply with specification(s) for monitoring and recording equipment);
20 DCMR § 602 (failure to comply with incinerator operating standards);
20 DCMR § 603.1 (failure to comply with PM emission limits);
20 DCMR § 603.3 (adding diluted air to the exhaust gas stream to avoid compliance with PM standards);
20 DCMR § 720.1 (distributing or manufacturing consumer products that exceed VOC limits);
20 DCMR § 724.1 (consumer products containing specified ozone depleting compounds);
20 DCMR § 725.4 (distributing or manufacturing consumer products containing methylene chloride, percholoroethylene, or trichloroethylene);
20 DCMR § 726.1 (distributing or manufacturing consumer products which contain specified toxic air contaminants);
20 DCMR § 727.1 (distributing or manufacturing uncertified charcoal lighter material);
20 DCMR § 732.9 (failure to comply with ACP agreement);
20 DCMR § 750.1 (distributing or manufacturing an AIM coating that exceeds specified VOC content);
20 DCMR § 750.5 (applying an AIM coating that exceeds VOC limit);
20 DCMR § 750.6 (applying an AIM rust preventative coating that exceeds VOC limit);
20 DCMR § 800.1 (failure to properly and timely notify of asbestos abatement);
20 DCMR § 800.3 (failure to comply with the requirements for obtaining an asbestos abatement permit or license);
20 DCMR § 800.5 (failure to apply for or renew an asbestos abatement permit or license);
20 DCMR § 800.6 (failure to provide asbestos worker protection);
(aa) 20 DCMR § 800.7 (failure to implement asbestos abatement control measures);
(bb) 20 DCMR § 801.1 (purchasing, selling, offering for sale, storing, transporting or using fuel oil which contains more than one percent (1%) sulfur);
(cc) 20 DCMR § 802.1 (purchasing, selling, offering for sale, storing, transporting or using coal which contains more than one percent (1%) sulfur);
(dd) 20 DCMR § 803.1 (failure to comply with sulfur emission limit);
(ee) 20 DCMR § 803.3 (adding diluted air to the exhaust gas stream to avoid compliance with SO2 standards);
(ff) 20 DCMR § 804.1 (failure to comply with NOx standard for fuel burning equipment);
(gg) 20 DCMR § 805.1 (failure to comply with NOx regulations);
(hh) 20 DCMR § 805.4(a) (failure to comply with combustion turbine emission standards);
(ii) 20 DCMR § 805.4(d) (failure to maintain continuous compliance at all times);
(jj) 20 DCMR § 805.5(b) (failure to comply with NOx emission rates on a calendar day average);
(kk) 20 DCMR § 805.5(c) (failure to comply with NOx emission rates);
(ll) 20 DCMR § 805.5(e) (failure to maintain continuous compliance at all times);
(mm) 20 DCMR § 805.6(a) (failure to comply with NOx emission rates);
(nn) 20 DCMR § 805.6(c) (failure to maintain continuous compliance at all times);
(oo) 20 DCMR § 805.7(b) (failure to reduce emissions as required by RACT emission control plan);
(pp) 20 DCMR § 805.7(c) (failure to maintain continuous compliance at all times, or failure to install and operate a CEM); or
(qq) 20 DCMR § 805.8 (failure to adjust combustion process).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 2 infraction:
20 DCMR § 107.2 (failure to provide notice of control equipment shutdown);
20 DCMR § 107.3 (failure to comply with an air pollution control notice);
20 DCMR § 107.4 (installation or use of any article, machine, equipment, device or contrivance which conceals an air pollution emission);
20 DCMR § 202.2(b) (failure to observe permit terms or conditions);
20 DCMR § 301.1 (failure to timely submit a complete permit application or renewal);
20 DCMR § 301.3(h) (failure to adhere to compliance plan);
20 DCMR § 302.1(c) (failure to maintain monitoring data/support information or to submit emission reports);
20 DCMR § 303.2 (operating after the time required to submit a timely and complete new permit application);
20 DCMR § 303.8 (failure to follow renovation and termination procedures);
20 DCMR § 500.1 (failure to file written reports);
20 DCMR § 500.2 (failure to maintain/provide records regarding emissions);
20 DCMR § 502.1 (failure to conduct air pollutant emission tests);
20 DCMR § 502.2 (failure to provide sampling facility/fuel sample);
20 DCMR § 502.5 (failure to perform NOx, SO2 or PM test accordingly);
20 DCMR § 502.6 (failure to properly test for sulfur);
20 DCMR § 600.1 (failure to comply with PM standard for fuel-burning equipment);
20 DCMR § 600.7 (blowing soot from coal fired boiler between 4 p.m. and 10 a.m.);
20 DCMR § 601.1 (selling/installing/using rotary cup burner);
20 DCMR § 601.2 (selling/using fuel oil in rotary cup burner);
20 DCMR § 606.1 (visible emission from stationary source);
20 DCMR § 606.2 (visible emission from fuel-burning equipment);
20 DCMR § 606.3 (failure to maintain/operate equipment);
20 DCMR § 606.5 (failure to train/supervise personnel);
20 DCMR § 700.2 (failure to comply with photochemically reactive solvent discharge rates);
20 DCMR § 700.3 (failure to comply with non-photochemically reactive discharge rates);
20 DCMR § 701 (failure to store petroleum liquid properly);
(aa) 20 DCMR § 703.1 (failure to maintain/operate terminal vapor recovery system);
(bb) 20 DCMR § 704.1 (failure to transfer volatile organic compounds or gasoline from delivery vessel to stationary source container as prescribed);
(cc) 20 DCMR § 704.2 (Stage I vapor recovery system does not include a return line or condensation system);
(dd) 20 DCMR § 704.4(a) (tank truck not refilled at facility with ninety percent (90%) vapor recovery system);
(ee) 20 DCMR § 704.4(b) (failure to conduct annual tank truck leak test);
(ff) 20 DCMR § 704.4(d) (failure to remove failed tank truck from service);
(gg) 20 DCMR § 704.6 (operating delivery system/vessels with a vapor or liquid leakage);
(hh) 20 DCMR § 705.1 (failure to use prescribed equipment during the transfer of gasoline to any vehicular fuel tank from any stationary storage container);
(ii) 20 DCMR § 709.1 (manufacturing, mixing, storing, using or applying cutback asphalt between April 1st and September 30th);
(jj) 20 DCMR § 710.1 (failure to operate in compliance with printing and engraving regulations);
(kk) 20 DCMR § 710.4 (using inks exceeding the VOC limits);
(ll) 20 DCMR § 710.6 (using control devices with less than ninety percent (90%) VOC reduction efficiency);
(mm) 20 DCMR § 710.10 (failure to prevent leaking);
(nn) 20 DCMR § 710.11 (failure to properly store or dispose any solvent-containing material);
(oo) 20 DCMR § 718.3 (application of coatings exceeding VOC limits); (pp) 20 DCMR § 718.5 (failure to use a proper application technique);
(qq) 20 DCMR § 731 (failure to comply with testing methods and maintain accurate records for consumer products);
(rr) 20 DCMR § 739 (failure to follow portable fuel container and spout testing procedures);
(ss) 20 DCMR § 754 (failure to comply with testing methods for AIM products);
(tt) 20 DCMR § 800.4(b) (failure to properly notify resilient floor covering removals);
(uu) 20 DCMR § 805.3(a) (failure to timely submit and receive approval for an emission control plan prior to implementation of NOx RACT); or
(vv) 20 DCMR § 805.7(e) (failure to perform tests that demonstrate NOx compliance).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 3 infraction:
20 DCMR § 200.6 (failure to submit permit applications on the correct forms or supply necessary data and information);
20 DCMR § 301.2 (failure to submit relevant facts or correct inaccurate information submitted in a permit application);
20 DCMR § 303.3 (operating after the time required to submit a timely and complete renewal permit application);
20 DCMR § 502.4 (failure to submit test reports);
20 DCMR § 605.1(e) (failure to control fugitive dust from demolition activity);
20 DCMR § 605.1(f) (failure to control fugitive dust from removal of demolition debris);
20 DCMR § 605.1(g) (failure to control fugitive dust from loading dusty material or sandblasting);
20 DCMR § 605.1(h) (failure to control fugitive dust from stockpile of dusty material);
20 DCMR § 605.2 (failure to control fugitive dust from other specified activities);
20 DCMR § 710.9 (failure to close VOC containing vessel when not in use);
20 DCMR § 727.3 (failure to submit relevant or correct information regarding charcoal lighter material);
20 DCMR § 730 (failure to comply with reporting requirements for consumer products);
20 DCMR § 732.8 (failure to maintain ACP records);
20 DCMR § 736 (failure to maintain spill-proof system);
20 DCMR § 743 (failure to follow cold cleaning procedures);
20 DCMR § 744 (failure to follow batch vapor cleaning procedures);
20 DCMR § 745 (failure to follow in-line vapor cleaning procedures);
20 DCMR § 746.1(b) – (g) (failure to follow Airless Airtight cleaning operations);
20 DCMR § 747 (failure to meet alternative compliance requirements);
20 DCMR § 753 (failure to properly submit AIM coating reports);
20 DCMR § 800.9 (failure to timely notify building occupants of impending asbestos abatement);
20 DCMR § 805.3(b) (failure to submit notification to comply with § 805.8);
20 DCMR § 805.4(b)(1) (failure to maintain in a logbook dates and hours of turbine operation);
20 DCMR § 805.7(d) (failure to maintain records); or
20 DCMR § 900.1 (idling engine for more than three (3) minutes).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 4 infraction:
20 DCMR § 604.1 (open burning);
20 DCMR § 605.1 (failure to minimize fugitive dust emissions);
20 DCMR § 605.1(a) (failure to control fugitive dust from unpaved road/roadway/parking lot);
20 DCMR § 605.1(b) (failure to control fugitive dust from paved road/roadway/parking lot);
20 DCMR § 605.1(c) (failure to control fugitive dust from vehicle transporting dusty material);
20 DCMR § 605.1(d) (failure to control fugitive dust from dirty vehicle);
20 DCMR § 605.3 (failure to comply with soil erosion and sedimentation control regulations);
20 DCMR § 704.4(e) (failure to post leak test certificate on tank truck);
20 DCMR § 704.4(f) (loading/unloading tank truck with no certificate);
20 DCMR § 705.6 (failure to comply with requirements for a vapor balance system);
20 DCMR § 705.7 (failure to maintain/operate balance system);
20 DCMR § 705.8 (refueling with nozzle not designed to automatically shutoff when tank is full);
20 DCMR § 705.10 (failure to maintain/operate Stage II vapor recovery system);
20 DCMR § 705.12 (failure to post operating instructions/warnings for Stage II vapor recovery system);
20 DCMR § 705.13 (failure to install/certified vapor control systems/components per required standards);
20 DCMR § 706.2 (failure to install/operate solvent recovery dryer or equivalent);
20 DCMR § 706.3 (failure to install/operate solvent filtration system);
20 DCMR § 706.4 (failure to minimize emissions from stored still waste);
20 DCMR § 706.5 (failure to repair solvent leak);
20 DCMR § 706.11 (failure to conduct weekly leak inspection);
20 DCMR § 707.1(a) (failure to properly operate a perchloroethylene dryer facility);
20 DCMR § 718.4 (failure to provide documentation of VOC content);
20 DCMR § 718.8 (failure to comply with housekeeping, pollution, and training measures);
20 DCMR § 727.5 (failure to timely notify regarding change in charcoal lighter material);
20 DCMR § 728.1 (failure to properly label floor wax strippers);
20 DCMR § 732.2 (failure to submit ACP agreement);
(aa) 20 DCMR § 732.4 (failure to properly submit ACP application);
(bb) 20 DCMR § 732.10 (failure to comply with surplus reduction regulations);
(cc) 20 DCMR § 733.1 (failure to submit CARB Innovative Product exemption for consumer products);
(dd) 20 DCMR § 740.1 (failure to submit Innovation Product exemption for portable fuel containers and spouts);
(ee) 20 DCMR § 746.1(a) (failure to properly record vapor cleaning);
(ff) 20 DCMR § 748 (failure to accurately record and monitor solvent cleaning operations);
(gg) 20 DCMR § 750.4 (failure to close AIM container when not in use);
(hh) 20 DCMR § 752 (failure to properly label AIM coatings);
(ii) 20 DCMR § 901.1 (visible emission for more than ten (10) seconds from vehicle); or
(jj) 20 DCMR § 903.1 (emitting odorous/other air pollutant).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 5 infraction:
20 DCMR § 718.7 (failure to properly clean spray gun);
20 DCMR § 729 (failure to properly label consumer products);
20 DCMR § 732.15 (failure to notify of ACP modifications);
20 DCMR § 738 (failure to properly label portable fuel containers and spouts).
Violation of any provision of of the Air Quality Control Regulations, 20 DCMR Chapters 1 through 9, which provision or rule is not cited elsewhere in this section, shall be a Class 4 infraction.
